intro: Ophiorrhiza chenii, commonly known as Chen's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It grows as a small shrub, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often on the branches of other trees. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually clustered at the base of the stems. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, and it produces berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ophiorrhiza chenii plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing resources for wildlife.
